intro: Baeria curta, commonly known as the shortleaf baeria, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Baeria curta is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, thriving in sunny conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
